alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Colbert and north central Franklin Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Belgreen, or 10 miles northwest of Russellville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville, Belgreen, Pleasant Site, Posey Loop, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Srygley Church, New Bethel, Crooked Oak and Rockwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
